column4: todsah-> type  lsmod |grep ip  does iptables shows up on the list?
Martha-> ethernet cable? or wifi?
yeah, I loaded all the modules in the netfilter dir, just to be sure :)
todsah-> type  lsmod |grep ip  does iptables shows up on the list?
ip_tables shows up.
Martha-> iwconfig    and whats the result?
todsah-> thats odd that you cant add a single rule
yeah. And it also won't change the default chain policies.
todsah-> reboot and see if things get corrected
it's like it ignores everything I throw at it.
hm. k.
I did mostly strip a desktop ubuntu of all things desktopy, maybe that's the problem.
Martha-> what is the name of your AP essid? maybe you are detecting a neighbors?
needhel2-> thats a conflicting statement
that fixed it.. thanks! Any idea what might've been the problem, or is it just a mystery-reboot-fix?
needhel2-> but you can ifdown eth0
todsah-> mystery...
Mmm, an untrustworthy firewall. shit :-P Well, thanks for the help anyway!
Martha-> access point, have you also at least google for some tutorials on wireless or you expect us to tell you everything?
todsah-> what the heck are you talking about? you dislike what i told you?
Martha is not really that difficult, but you got to have some basic knowhow of what you wanted done
Nope, nothing you said. Just pointing out that it's too bad we probably won't figure out what the problem was. Guess I just got to hope it won't happen again.
yeah sometimes things happens that we dont have the explanations
